org.jscsi.target.util

Class ReadWrite

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jscsi.target.util.ReadWrite

  • public final class ReadWrite
extends Object
    This utility class contains static methods for reading/writing integers of various lengths and character strings from/to ByteBuffer objects and byte arrays.
    Author:
    Andreas Ergenzinger

      ReadWrite()

      • readOneByteInt

        public static final int readOneByteInt(ByteBuffer buffer,
                 int start)
        Reads a specified byte from a ByteBuffer and returns its value as an unsigned integer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuffer containing the byte
        start - the index position of the byte in the ByteBuffer
        Returns:
        the unsigned integer value of the byte

      • readOneByteInt

                 int start)
        Reads a specified byte from a byte array and returns its value as an unsigned integer.
        Parameters:
        array - the array containing the byte
        start - the index position of the byte in the array
        Returns:
        the unsigned integer value of the byte

      • readTwoByteInt

        public static final int readTwoByteInt(ByteBuffer buffer,
                 int start)
        Reads an unsigned 2-byte integer from two consecutive big-endian-ordered bytes of a ByteBuffer object and returns the value.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuffer containing the bytes
        start - the index position of the most-significant byte
        Returns:
        the unsigned value of the two-byte integer

        Returns:

      • readFourByteInt

        Parameters:
        array - the byte array containing the bytes
        start - the index position of the most-significant byte
        Returns:
        the unsigned value of the four-byte integer

      • stringToTextDataSegments

        public static ByteBuffer[] stringToTextDataSegments(String string,
                                    int bufferSize)
        Puts the characters in the passed String into an array of one or more ByteBuffers and returns it.

        If the String does not end with a null character, one will be appended. If the String's length is larger than the specified bufferSize, all but the last ByteBuffer will have capacity() = bufferSize, the last one will contain the remaining String characters.

        Parameters:
        string - the String to be put into the ByteBuffer
        bufferSize - the maximum size of the returned ByteBuffers
        Returns:
        an array of ByteBuffers containing the passed String

      • appendTextDataSegmentToStringBuffer

        public static final void appendTextDataSegmentToStringBuffer(ByteBuffer byteBuffer,
                                       StringBuilder stringBuilder)
        Appends the content of a ProtocolDataUnit (text) data segment to a StringBuilder;
        Parameters:
        byteBuffer - the PDU's data segment
        stringBuilder - the StringBuilder that will be extended

      • writeInt

        public static final void writeInt(int value,
            ByteBuffer buffer,
            int start)
        Writes the given value to the buffer in big-endian format, with the index position of the most significant byte being start. To get the value back from the buffer, use readUnsignedInt.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer to write to the ByteBuffer
        buffer - where the integer will be stored
        start - index of the most significant byte of the stored value

      • byteBufferToString

        public static String byteBufferToString(ByteBuffer buffer)
        Returns the bytes in a ByteBuffer as a UTF-8 encoded String.
        Parameters:
        buffer - a ByteBuffer containing UTF-8 encoded characters.
        Returns:
        a String representation of the buffer's content

      • longToBytes

        public static byte[] longToBytes(long value)
        Splits the passed value into bytes and returns them in an array, in big-endian format.
        Parameters:
        value - the long to split
        Returns:
        byte representation of the parameter

      • writeLong

        public static void writeLong(ByteBuffer buffer,
             long value,
             int index)
        Writes the given value to the buffer in big-endian format, with the index position of the most significant byte being index.
        Parameters:
        value - the integer to write to the ByteBuffer
        buffer - where the integer will be stored
        index - index of the most significant byte of the stored value

      • writeTwoByteInt

        public static void writeTwoByteInt(ByteBuffer buffer,
                   int value,
                   int index)
        Writes the two least-significant big-endian-ordered bytes of an integer the a specified position in a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - where the bytes will be written
        value - the value to convert and copy
        index - the position of the most significant byte in the ByteBuffer

      • writeThreeByteInt

        public static void writeThreeByteInt(ByteBuffer buffer,
                     int value,
                     int index)
        Writes the three least-significant big-endian-ordered bytes of an integer the a specified position in a ByteBuffer.
        Parameters:
        buffer - where the bytes will be written
        value - the value to convert and copy
        index - the position of the most significant byte in the ByteBuffer

      • readUnsignedInt

        public static long readUnsignedInt(ByteBuffer buffer,
                   int start)
        Reads an unsigned 4-byte integer from four consecutive big-endian-ordered bytes of a ByteBuffer object and returns the value.
        Parameters:
        buffer - the ByteBuffer containing the bytes
        start - the index position of the most-significant byte
        Returns:
        the value of the unsigned four-byte integer
